intro: Erigeron velutipes, commonly known as the downy fleabane, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to North America and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into fluffy, seed-filled spheres. Erigeron velutipes is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
